Key Match Events: The Suns led by as many as 16 points but struggled to put away the Jazz until the fourth quarter.
Allen hit his only 3-pointer of the game early in the fourth quarter to make it a six-point Suns lead and they pulled away after that.
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns have won three of four since coach Mike Budenholzer reorganized the Suns' rotation with Bradley Beal coming off the bench.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns beat the Jazz for the third time this season.
Jazz: Played without regulars Jordan Clarkson, Keyonte George and John Collins, but still got contributions from reserves Svi Mykhailiuk and Cody Williams with 13 points apiece.
Suns: Beal had his lowest output since moving into a reserve role, scoring 12 points in 31 minutes.
Others: Mason Plumlee scored the first five Suns points (six for the game) and finished with 10 rebounds, starting in place of Jusuf Nurkic, who did not play for the second straight game after serving a three-game suspension.
